instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
threads.message:
At <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.56v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> =5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> =3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3S5_ENTRIP1</SIGNAL>=800mv
<SIGNAL>PP5VS3_ENTRIP2</SIGNAL>=800mv
<SIGNAL>5VP3V3_REG_EN</SIGNAL>=3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5VS3_VBST_R</SIGNAL>=5v
<SIGNAL>PP5VS3_LL</SIGNAL>=0v

I’m seeing that both entrip signals are low so both s5 and s3 should be up. If I’m reading the schematic correctly. I have no short on s3 line. someone has already Been in this area and flux is all over it :/

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
threads.message:
We take our time to write correctly here (even capital letters for signal names); why don't you do the same, as first interested?

Post some history fault, sometime helps.

Check R/<CAPACITOR>C7224</CAPACITOR> and all resistors/traces from <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
threads.message:
Ok I will R/<CAPACITOR>C7224</CAPACITOR> and all the traces.
History fault
MagSafe has dim green light.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.56v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> =5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>=3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5_S3</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>=0v
No fan spin. No shorts found on any of the above lines.

threads.message:

You probably meant <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>...

threads.message:

threads.message: Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
threads.message:
There is no resistor divider, untill <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> close it to ground.

Post <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86 ohm values, measured onboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>/85 look good.
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> is stable?
Just in case, replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
threads.message:
I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and I have the same issue 
But I noticed the <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>= 16.71-16.04v fluctuating again I’m thinking there must be a loose connection or bad solder Joint somewhere there also flux around the mage safe and fuse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no s3 rails
threads.message:
Not relevant fluctuation.
Check solders and traces around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

Remove F7040 and see if <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> voltage is stable then.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> is good; better to replace.
